body:
# PlaceOS Crystal SDK

[![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/placeos/crystal-client.svg)](https://github.com/placeos/crystal-client/releases)
[![CI](https://github.com/PlaceOS/crystal-client/actions/workflows/ci.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/PlaceOS/crystal-client/actions/workflows/ci.yml)

A library for building [crystal](crystal-lang.org/) applications that utilise PlaceOS.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     placeos:
       github: placeos/crystal-client
       version: ~> 1.0
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

When initialialized via the host environment, the key `PLACE_URI` is expected.

### Authentication

- *from environment*

    ```crystal
    require "placeos"

    # Extracts user credentials from the following environment keys...
    # - PLACE_URI
    # - PLACE_EMAIL
    # - PLACE_PASSWORD
    # - PLACE_AUTH_CLIENT_ID
    # - PLACE_AUTH_SECRET
    client = PlaceOS::Client.from_environment_user
    ```

## Development

Run `crystal spec`

## Contributing

1. [Fork it](https://github.com/placeos/crystal-client/fork)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Kim Burgess](https://github.com/kimburgess) - creator and maintainer
- [Caspian Baska](https://github.com/caspiano) - contributor and maintainer

types.name: PlaceOS
types.doc:
Low-level wrapper for the PlaceOS API.

Each method maps one-to-one with an API endpoint. All invocations will either
provide a type-safe response object, or raise an `PlaceOS::Client::API::Error`.

It's possible to use this class directly if you require the extra flexibility,
however in most cases the abstractions provided by the higher-level
`PlaceOS::Client` may be the better choice.

def.name: from_environment_user
def.body:
environment = {"PLACE_URI", "PLACE_EMAIL", "PLACE_PASSWORD", "PLACE_AUTH_CLIENT_ID", "PLACE_AUTH_SECRET"}.map do |key|
  ENV[key]? || (abort("missing #{key} in environment"))
end
uri, email, password, client_id, client_secret = environment
new(uri, email: email, password: password, client_id: client_id, client_secret: client_secret)

def.name: from_environment_user
def.body:
begin
  client = self.from_environment_user
  yield client
ensure
  client.close
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (base_uri : URI | String, email : String? = nil, password : String? = nil, client_id : String? = nil, client_secret : String? = nil, token : OAuth2::AccessToken? = nil, host_header : String? = nil, insecure : Bool = false, x_api_key : String? = nil)
constructors.args_html: (base_uri : URI | String, email : String? = nil, password : String? = nil, client_id : String? = nil, client_secret : String? = nil, token : OAuth2::AccessToken? = nil, host_header : String? = nil, insecure : Bool = false, x_api_key : String? = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(base_uri, email, password, client_id, client_secret, token, host_header, insecure, x_api_key)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: from_response
def.body:
if response.success?
  raise(ArgumentError.new("response is valid"))
else
  new(response.status_message || "HTTP error #{response.status_code}")
end

types.name: Authority
types.doc:
Metadata about the PlaceOS instance connected to.

This provides information that may be of relevance for authentication or
providing client-side configuration information.
types.summary: Metadata about the PlaceOS instance connected to.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (uri : URI | String, host_header : String? = nil, insecure = false, &authenticate : HTTP::Client -> )
constructors.args_html: (uri : URI | String, host_header : String? = nil, insecure = false, &authenticate : HTTP::Client -> )

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(uri, host_header, insecure, &authenticate) do |_arg0|
  yield _arg0
end
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (uri : URI | String, host_header : String? = nil, insecure = false)
constructors.args_html: (uri : URI | String, host_header : String? = nil, insecure = false)

def.name: connection
def.body:
HTTP::Client.new(uri) do |client|
  if insecure
    client.tls?.try(&.verify_mode = :NONE)
  end
  authenticate.call(client)
  yield client
end

instance_methods.name: search
instance_methods.doc:
List or search for zones.

Results maybe filtered by specifying a query - *q* - to search across zone
attributes. A small query language is supported within this:

Operator | Action
-------- | ------
`+`      | Matches both terms
`|`      | Matches either terms
`-`      | Negates a single token
`"`      | Wraps tokens to form a phrase
`(`  `)` | Provides precedence
`~N`     | Specifies edit distance (fuzziness) after a word
`~N`     | Specifies slop amount (deviation) after a phrase

Up to *limit* zones will be returned, with a paging based on *offset*.

Results my also also be limited to those associated with specific *tags*.

instance_methods.args_html: (q : String? = nil, limit : Int = 20, offset : Int = 0, authority_id : String? = nil)

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc:
Creates a new system.

Systems must be given a unique *name* within the PlaceOS instance they are
running from. Additionally, a system must be a member of at least one
*zone*. All other attributes are optional at the time of creation.
instance_methods.args_string: (name : String, zones : Array(String), description : String? = nil, email : String? = nil, capacity : Int? = nil, bookable : Bool? = nil, installed_ui_devices : Int? = nil, modules : Array(String)? = nil, support_url : String? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (name : String, zones : Array(String), description : String? = nil, email : String? = nil, capacity : Int? = nil, bookable : Bool? = nil, installed_ui_devices : Int? = nil, modules : Array(String)? = nil, support_url : String? = nil)

instance_methods.doc: Executes a behaviour exposed by a module within the passed system *id*.
instance_methods.summary: Executes a behaviour exposed by a module within the passed system id.
instance_methods.args_string: (id : String, module_name : String, method : String, index : Int32 = 1, *args : Array(JSON::Any::Type))
instance_methods.args_html: (id : String, module_name : String, method : String, index : Int32 = 1, *args : Array(JSON::Any::Type))

instance_methods.doc: Queries the behaviour exposed by a module within system *id*.
instance_methods.summary: Queries the behaviour exposed by a module within system id.
instance_methods.args_string: (id : String, module_name : String, index : Int = 1)
instance_methods.args_html: (id : String, module_name : String, index : Int = 1)

instance_methods.name: search
instance_methods.doc:
List or search for systems.

Results maybe filtered by specifying a query - *q* - to search across system
attributes. A small query language is supported within this:

Operator | Action
-------- | ------
`+`      | Matches both terms
`|`      | Matches either terms
`-`      | Negates a single token
`"`      | Wraps tokens to form a phrase
`(`  `)` | Provides precedence
`~N`     | Specifies edit distance (fuzziness) after a word
`~N`     | Specifies slop amount (deviation) after a phrase

Up to *limit* systems will be returned, with a paging based on *offset*.
instance_methods.args_string: (q : String? = nil, limit : Int = 1000, offset : Int = 0, zone_id : String? = nil, module_id : String? = nil, features : String? = nil, capacity : Int32? = nil, bookable : Bool? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (q : String? = nil, limit : Int = 1000, offset : Int = 0, zone_id : String? = nil, module_id : String? = nil, features : String? = nil, capacity : Int32? = nil, bookable : Bool? = nil)

instance_methods.args_html: (id : String)

instance_methods.summary: Queries the state exposed by a module within the passed system id.
instance_methods.args_string: (id : String, module_name : String, index : Int = 1, lookup : String? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (id : String, module_name : String, index : Int = 1, lookup : String? = nil)

def.name: state
def.body:
path = "#{base}/#{id}/#{module_name}_#{index}"
if lookup.nil?
else
  path = path + "/#{lookup}"
end
get(path)

instance_methods.name: update
instance_methods.doc:
Requests a change to an existing system.

In addition to specifying the ID of the system to update, you must reference
the the current system metadata *version* for the update to be allowed. This
must match the current version attribute of the system and will be
incrememented following a successful update.
instance_methods.summary: Requests a change to an existing system.
instance_methods.args_string: (id : String, version : Int, name : String? = nil, zones : Array(String)? = nil, description : String? = nil, email : String? = nil, capacity : Int? = nil, bookable : Bool? = nil, installed_ui_devices : Int? = nil, modules : Array(String)? = nil, support_url : String? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (id : String, version : Int, name : String? = nil, zones : Array(String)? = nil, description : String? = nil, email : String? = nil, capacity : Int? = nil, bookable : Bool? = nil, installed_ui_devices : Int? = nil, modules : Array(String)? = nil, support_url : String? = nil)

def.name: update
def.body: put("#{base}/#{id}", params: "version=#{version}", body: from_args, as: System)

instance_methods.name: with_emails
instance_methods.doc: Returns systems with a specified email address(es)
instance_methods.summary: Returns systems with a specified email address(es)
instance_methods.args_string: (list : Array(String) | String)
instance_methods.args_html: (list : Array(String) | String)

def.name: with_emails
def.body:
query = list.is_a?(Array) ? list.join(',') : list
get("#{base}/with_emails", params: HTTP::Params {"in" => query}, as: Array(System))

instance_methods.name: search
instance_methods.doc:
List or search for users.

Results maybe filtered by specifying a query - *q* - to search across zone
attributes. A small query language is supported within this:

Operator | Action
-------- | ------
`+`      | Matches both terms
`|`      | Matches either terms
`-`      | Negates a single token
`"`      | Wraps tokens to form a phrase
`(`  `)` | Provides precedence
`~N`     | Specifies edit distance (fuzziness) after a word
`~N`     | Specifies slop amount (deviation) after a phrase

Up to *limit* zones will be returned, with a paging based on *offset*.

Results my also also be limited to those associated with specific *tags*.
instance_methods.args_string: (q : String? = nil, limit : Int = 20, offset : Int = 0, authority_id : String? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (q : String? = nil, limit : Int = 20, offset : Int = 0, authority_id : String? = nil)

instance_methods.name: base
instance_methods.doc: The base route for the endpoint

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc: Creates a new zone.
instance_methods.args_string: (name : String, description : String? = nil, tags : Array(String)? = nil, settings : Settings? = nil, triggers : Array(String)? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (name : String, description : String? = nil, tags : Array(String)? = nil, settings : Settings? = nil, triggers : Array(String)? = nil)

instance_methods.name: execute
instance_methods.args_string: (id : String, method : String, module_name : String, index : Int32 = 1, args = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (id : String, method : String, module_name : String, index : Int32 = 1, args = nil)

instance_methods.name: search
instance_methods.doc:
List or search for zones.

Results maybe filtered by specifying a query - *q* - to search across zone
attributes. A small query language is supported within this:

Operator | Action
-------- | ------
`+`      | Matches both terms
`|`      | Matches either terms
`-`      | Negates a single token
`"`      | Wraps tokens to form a phrase
`(`  `)` | Provides precedence
`~N`     | Specifies edit distance (fuzziness) after a word
`~N`     | Specifies slop amount (deviation) after a phrase

Up to *limit* zones will be returned, with a paging based on *offset*.

Results my also also be limited to those associated with specific *tags*.
instance_methods.args_string: (q : String? = nil, limit : Int = 20, offset : Int = 0, parent : String? = nil, tags : Array(String) | String? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (q : String? = nil, limit : Int = 20, offset : Int = 0, parent : String? = nil, tags : Array(String) | String? = nil)

instance_methods.name: update
instance_methods.doc: Updates zone attributes or configuration.
instance_methods.args_string: (id : String, name : String? = nil, description : String? = nil, tags : Array(String)? = nil, settings : Settings? = nil, triggers : Array(String)? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (id : String, name : String? = nil, description : String? = nil, tags : Array(String)? = nil, settings : Settings? = nil, triggers : Array(String)? = nil)
